instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging, works with battery
threads.message:
Hi all, I'm new (posting) to the forums so please be gentle.

This 16" Macbook came in not charging, was running on battery but all but one USB-C port were registering voltage of 20V 0A. UB300 was getting warm and showing 5V/0V on each side of its USB-C connector. I replaced the CD3217B and now I get 20V 0A on all but the corresponding port for UB300 which shows 20V 0.004A. I have also replaced charging IC <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> with the same results. The board shows 5V when battery not connected and won't boot. I am using a 96W non OEM charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging, works with battery
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

I recommend to get all ORIGINAL APPLE set of chargers.
So you get 0.004A one port only?
Compare diode mode to ground readings between all USB-C ports.
Do you get correct LDOs on all them?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging, works with battery
threads.message:
Please, use schematic refferences, instead of left/right, top/bottom, etc.

Check and compare diode mode readings between pages 32 & 112.
You may have 1 or more <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> bad.
All USB-C ports must have the same behavior.
Remove their connecors from the shell and inspect the terminals.

Actually, with charged battery, machine turns on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging, works with battery
threads.message:
OK I'll try another <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> as I have just received another batch. 

The Macbook works with the battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging, works with battery
threads.message:
Then your problem is located on USB-C areas.
Be sure <CHIP>U2890</CHIP> and UB090 have good solders and traces.
Just in case, you can try to reflash them; make backup first!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging, works with battery
threads.message: Changed CB300 with same outcome. I have ordered some USON-8 templates from PCBWay, do you have a dump for <CHIP>U2890</CHIP>/UB090 or know of firmware dump source?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging, works with battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging, works with battery
threads.message: Hi, I reflashed UB090 and <CHIP>U2890</CHIP> and now I am getting 20V 0.065A on all ports with and without battery connected. The Macbook will not boot at all now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging, works with battery
threads.message:
Is the battery charging now?
Not booting with battery at all?

Try DFU restore, if no data need to save.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging, works with battery
threads.message: Not charging, not booting with battery... I'll speak to the owner with regards to data.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging, works with battery
threads.message:
OK, I attempted DFU restore with original apple charger and Thunderbolt 3 cable, all I get every attempt is:

'Gave up waiting for device to transition from DFU to DFU state [com.apple.MobileDevice.MobileRestore - 0FCA (4042)] . Target Macbook is at 20V 0.066A most of the time.

Should I reflash UB090 and <CHIP>U2890</CHIP> back to original firmware? It would at least boot on battery before the reflash.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging, works with battery
threads.message:
Yes, put back TBT ROMs.
Then try DFU again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging, works with battery
threads.message: I reflashed the 2 TBT ROMs, I get the same error message when attempting DFU restore although 5V 0.270A is now showing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging, works with battery
threads.message:
Probably not good ROM files, if got 20V before reflashing.

Still not working with battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging, works with battery
threads.message: No, wont work with battery now, I had 20V before and after reflashing with the dumps you provided, with the original I now get 5V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging, works with battery
threads.message:
If you didn't move anything on the board, then something reacted to the heat.
Maybe need to resolder/reball <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chips.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging, works with battery
threads.message:
I've reflowed everything on that side, still no joy. I'm awaiting new <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> but I feel I'm wasting my time on this board now.

Would it be worth replacing ALL the CD3217s? I only originally replaced the two on the side where one was faulty/getting hot.
